name: prorated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
calculated according to the amount of something that has been used, in relation to a larger total amount: Attendees joining the course later will pay a prorated fee. Any new projects would be funded on a prorated basis. See
prorate
More examplesFewer examplesA prorated portion of the fee will be refunded.If you discontinue the cable service during the month, and you will receive a prorated refund.Businesses are required to provide seven paid sick days a year to full-time workers and a prorated number to part-timers.
